description: From -ic and French butyrique, -ique suffixed to Latin būtȳrum, or from the Latin or butyro- +‎ ic. Piecewise doublet of buttery, butter ultimately being from the Latin and -y being a doublet of -ic.

adjectives.description: butyric (comparative more butyric, superlative most butyric)

entries.meaning: (rare) Of, pertaining to, or characteristic of butter
(organic chemistry) Of, pertaining to, or derived from butyric acid or any of the isomeric univalent radicals of formula C3H7CO2-
